revised_title: Noradrenaline Storage and Release in the Decentralized Spleen: A Study on the Effects of Neuronal Rest
tldr: The study investigates the effects of decentralizing the sympathetic postganglionic neurons of the cat's spleen for 72 hours on noradrenaline storage and release. Decentralization causes a 40% increase in the noradrenaline content of the spleen, but the proportion of the transmitter released by nerve stimulation remains the same as in a normal spleen. The findings provide insights into the mechanisms of noradrenaline storage and release in the spleen.
